name: Web Application Security
description: Security checklist for web applications based on OWASP Top 10

items.title: Implement proper input validation
items.description: Validate all input on the server side to prevent injection attacks.

items.title: Implement strong authentication
items.description: Use strong authentication mechanisms and enforce MFA where possible.

items.title: Use HTTPS for all connections
items.description: Ensure all connections use HTTPS to encrypt data in transit.

items.title: Implement proper session management
items.description: Use secure session management techniques to prevent session hijacking.

items.title: Implement proper access controls
items.description: Ensure that users can only access resources they are authorized to access.

items.title: Protect against XSS attacks
items.description: Implement proper output encoding to prevent cross-site scripting attacks.

items.title: Implement proper error handling
items.description: Ensure that errors are handled properly and don't reveal sensitive information.

items.title: Implement proper logging and monitoring
items.description: Log security-relevant events and monitor for suspicious activity.

items.title: Use secure dependencies
items.description: Use a dependency checker to ensure that dependencies are up to date and free of known vulnerabilities.

items.title: Implement security headers
items.description: Implement security headers like Content-Security-Policy, X-Content-Type-Options, etc.

items.title: Protect against CSRF attacks
items.description: Implement anti-CSRF tokens to prevent cross-site request forgery attacks.

items.title: Implement rate limiting
items.description: Implement rate limiting to prevent brute force and DoS attacks.
